page.title: 04A VIEW OF BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content:
WEST END ENGINEERS IS MADE OUT OF BRICK AND CONCRETE BLOCKS .WEST END ENGINEERS IS A SMALL{FACTORY}AND IT DEALS WITH MACHINERY AND METALS AS WELL. } BUCKLAND BREWER{SCHOOL}HAS ABOUT 77 CHILDREN. THE MAIN PART OF THE SCHOOL IS 108 YEARS OLD AND HAS WALLS OF STONE AND BRICK. LATER ADDITIONS HAVE RENDERED WALLS AND TAR AND FELT ROOFS COVERED WITH STONE CHIPPINGS. THE MAIN SCHOOL ROOF IS MADE OF TILE.
STONE IS THE MOST WIDELY USED {BUILDING MATERIAL,}OCCURRING IN NEARLY HALF OF THE AREA'S HOUSES. COB,A MIXTURE OF MUD,STRAW,ETC,IS FOUND IN ONE HOUSE IN EIGHT,WHILE ONE THIRD OF ALL HOUSES ARE COVERED WITH A MIXTURE OF SAND AND CEMENT FOR ADDITIONAL PROTECTION. CONCRETE BLOCKS,BRICKS AND WOOD ARE OTHER WALL MATERIALS.
